hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Liquidity Breakdown
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when aggregate stablecoin market cap (USDT+USDC) declines for 5 consecutive days while BTC's price breaks below the lower Bollinger Band (20,2) on increasing volume (>20% above 20-day avg), a transition to BEAR occurs within 2-4 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stablecoin outflow indicates capital leaving the ecosystem, reducing buy-side liquidity. A breakdown below Bollinger support on high volume confirms selling pressure overcoming the neutral range, often initiating a bearish phase.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Short position: 12% gain or BEAR regime confirmation
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims lower BB and stablecoin flows turn positive
exit_conditions.time_exit: 6 trading days without regime shift to BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Market finds immediate support and rebounds back into neutral range despite conditions, or stablecoin flows reverse positive within 2 days.
